trans-unit.source: The following table lists limitations on XML data types in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: This table lists the limitations on <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> XML data types.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists the limitations on <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> XML data types.

target.mrk: This table lists the limitations on <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> XML data types.

trans-unit.source: Requires that the JAXP parser classes (such as Apache Xerces) and the Apache Xalan classes are in the classpath. Attempts to use XML operators without these classes in the classpath result in an error. In some situations, you may need to take steps to place the parser and Xalan in your classpath. See "XML data types and operators" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for details.

seg-source.mrk: Requires that the JAXP parser classes (such as Apache Xerces) and the Apache Xalan classes are in the classpath.
Attempts to use XML operators without these classes in the classpath result in an error.
In some situations, you may need to take steps to place the parser and Xalan in your classpath.
See "XML data types and operators" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for details.

target.mrk: Requires that the JAXP parser classes (such as Apache Xerces) and the Apache Xalan classes are in the classpath.
Attempts to use XML operators without these classes in the classpath result in an error.
In some situations, you may need to take steps to place the parser and Xalan in your classpath.
See "XML data types and operators" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for details.
